sub_title: Stakeholder Management I Public Affairs, Policy & Partnerships I Learning/Education/Edtech/Publishing
summary:
A pro-active, curious, and energetic professional, specialised in strategic partnerships, stakeholder management, and public policy/affairs in the field of Education, Science, Innovation, Technology (edtech & artificial intelligence) publishing and healthcare. Driven by societal issues and topics, and highly motivated by using innovation to create a better world. Interested in social enterprises or companies with a societal mission. Fascinated by working in the 'in-betweens' of the public and the private sector. When they work together, amazing things can happen. I am the person that can facilitate that connection. 

Skilled in building networks within complex international environments and stakeholder management (businesses, universities, national and European governments and NGO’s) with experience in the public sector as policy advisor and lobbyist, and in the private sector in account management, third-party strategic partnerships, and providing training and coaching to (local) teams. 

Global mindset with work experience in various countries (Australia, Norway, UK, Belgium, Italy, Singapore), and proficient in several languages (Dutch, English, Italian, German). Master's degree in International Relations. 

Collector of places and experiences, and it is my life goal to visit at least 100 countries in the world (I am currently at 45) and learn as many languages as I can (I am currently at 8 and studying for my Mandarin HSK level 2 exam). 

Currently working and living in Amsterdam, after having spent 7+ years in the beautiful cities of London and Singapore.

projects.title: The Roadmap for European Hematology Research
projects.description: The Roadmap for European Hematology Research highlights major achievements in diagnosis and treatment of blood disorders and identifies the greatest unmet clinical and scientific needs in those areas to enable better funded, more focused European hematology research. Initiated by the EHA, around 300 experts contributed to the consensus document, which will help European policy makers, research funders, research organizations, researchers, and patient groups make better informed decisions on hematology research. It also aims to raise public awareness of the burden of blood disorders on European society, which purely in economic terms is estimated at Euro 23 billion per year, a level of cost that is not matched in current European hematology research funding. In recent decades, hematology research has improved our fundamental understanding of the biology of blood disorders, and has improved diagnostics and treatments, sometimes in revolutionary ways. This progress highlights the potential of focused basic research programs such as this EHA Roadmap. The EHA Roadmap identifies nine sections in hematology: normal hematopoiesis, malignant lymphoid and myeloid diseases, anemias and related diseases, platelet disorders, blood coagulation and hemostatic disorders, transfusion medicine, infections in hematology, and hematopoietic stem cell transplantation. These sections span 60 smaller groups of diseases or disorders. The EHA Roadmap identifies priorities and needs across the field of hematology, including those to develop targeted therapies based on genomic profiling and chemical biology, to eradicate minimal residual malignant disease, and to develop cellular immunotherapies, combination treatments, gene therapies, hematopoietic stem cell treatments, and treatments that are better tolerated by elderly patients.

projects.title: 'Product owner' - student website of Utrecht University
projects.description:
Project to renew the student website of Utrecht University. In this project, my responsibility was to represent the interests and the wishes of the Faculty of Humanities, counting 7000 students, and translating them into technical functionalities. Project was based on the 'Scrum'​ methodology (agile development framework), and the governance of the project on the Prince2 methodology.

Result: http://students.uu.nl/

profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Advisor / Work Package Lead - EU funded project EPICUR

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for global partnerships, public affairs and stakeholder management at Singaporean Education Technology company Cialfo, with a focus on European markets. 

Cialfo, launched in Sep 2017, is a one-stop solution that brings together people, software, and data to simplify higher education and career counseling workflows. Students, counselors, parents, college/university representatives use Cialfo to hope, dream and collaborate. We’re on a mission to make higher education accessible for 100 million students by 2025.

• Top 50 Edtech companies 2020 by HolonIQ
• Top 5 startups to watch in 2017
• Winner of EdTechX Asia 2016
• Featured in Forbes, CNBC, Wall Street Journal, Edsurge, VentureBeat, Straits Times, VulcanPost, TechinAsia, and over 100 publications globally
• Winner of Education Investor Award 2018 - edtech provider of the year

Responsibilities:

- Lead on the external relationships, strategic partnerships and business development for Cialfo in UK and Europe
- Responsible for B2B Partnerships and sales
- Established and grew the business from scratch in UK and Europe, all the way through to Series B investment 
- Responsible for public affairs and key exposure such as the meet-up with the Irish Prime Minister (see media attachments)
profile_positions.title: Global Associate Director of Partnerships

profile_positions.description:
Pearson is the world's leading education and publishing company, with more than 35,000 employees in over 70 countries. Pearson is a multinational FTSE 100 company. I work for Pearson's digital assessment business, on the Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE Academic). PTE Academic is the world's first entirely computer-based English language test for international study and immigration that is accepted across the world. Powered by AI technology, PTE Academic provides a fast and convenient testing solution without human bias.

Responsible for global partnerships, government relations, public affairs and stakeholder management of PTE Academic, including Europe, and selected other markets such as Hong Kong and China. 


Responsibilities:
- Spearhead the external relationships, strategic partnerships and government relations for the Pearson Test of English Academic, with a large customer portfolio (1000+) in various industries including public sector, education, healthcare, engineering, tech, transport (TfL, Uber)
- Manage partnerships and key account holder of EdTech start-up and scale-ups (e.g. Studyportals) for multi-year large contract agreements
- Play a pivotal role in streamlining strategy and managing stakeholders for negotiations of global contracts as well as B2B marketing and business development strategy.
profile_positions.title: Global Partnerships Manager - Asia

profile_positions.description:
Promoted after one year to Global Partnerships & Recognition Services Manager. Expanded the portfolio to global coverage. Responsible for global partnerships and stakeholder management of PTE Academic, including Europe, the UAE, and activities in selected other markets such as the United States. Have held client meetings in all European countries, UK, US, UAE, Vietnam. 

Leading on partnerships and key account holder of EdTech start-up and scale-ups for multi-year large contract agreements. Responsible for sign-on and launch of Pearson/Studyportals partnership, subsequently leading and managing the partnership from the Pearson side.
profile_positions.title: Global Partnerships Manager
European Client Relations Manager

profile_positions.description:
Selected for the world's largest cross-company mentoring scheme, through my employer Pearson. In the UK, the scheme consists of FTSE100 companies, with the aim to reach at least 30% representation of women on all boards and C-suites globally. 

About 30% club:
The 30% Club believes that gender balance on boards and in senior management not only encourages better leadership and governance, but diversity and inclusion further contributes to better all-round board performance, and ultimately increased corporate performance for both companies and their shareholders. Diversity and the fostering of inclusive workplaces also plays an important role in increasing innovation, attracting and retaining talent, and enhancing reputation and brand.

 Our global mission is to reach at least 30% representation of all women on all boards and C-suites globally. For more information see: https://30percentclub.org/
profile_positions.title: Selected mentee in FTSE 100 cross-company mentoring scheme - 30% club

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for public affairs, public relations and stakeholder relations for the medical specialty of hematology in Europe (European Commission and European Parliament), on issues such as access to medicine, personalized medicine, public health, clinical trials, data protection regulation, research funding (Horizon2020, IMI) and harmonization of medical education across Europe. 

Project management of various portfolios:

- Hematology Awareness Campaign:  public relations & communications campaign to raise awareness on Blood disorders and the effect on European Society. 
- Working together with communications/public relations agency on campaigns 
- Coordination of strategy and research agenda for priorities of the upcoming 5-10 years, result: The Research Roadmap for Hematology in Europe (see publications) 
- Contact person for European research funding programs (Horizon2020, Marie Curie, IMI)
- Managed partnerships with stakeholder groups: pharmaceutical and medical devices industry, academia, patient organisations, policy makers and politicians, patient and nurses’ organisations, and Early Career (junior) physicians
-Represented the organisation in stakeholder forums in Brussels, to European politicians (MEP’s and European Commission) and other stakeholder industry groups (e.g. pharmaceutical industry, Biomed alliance).
- Frequent (European) travel, partially based in Brussels. 
- Published author in two leading and renowned medical journals

Training:
- European Biopharmaceutical Enterprises Regulatory Training Seminar on Personalised Medicine (March 2, 2015)
- Argumentation skills for Public Affairs Professionals (April 13, 2016)
profile_positions.title: European Public Affairs Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Professional registered member of the official Dutch Membership Organisation of Public Affairs professionals. 

Organisation statement: Public Affairs is a profession that, according to the BVPA, must be conducted in all openness. The BVPA encourages initiatives that lead to greater transparency and democratic accountability.
profile_positions.title: Professional member of BVPA -  Dutch membership organisation for Public Affairs Professionals

profile_positions.description:
Advisor of board, directors and management on a broad range of research and education policy dossiers.

Project management of various portfolios: 

Research
- Contact person for the Netherlands Organisation for Scientific Research (NWO) about research funding programmes (Veni, Vidi, Vici, Promoties in de Geesteswetenschappen and Aspasia)
- Learning and talent development (including diversity policy and promoting gender equality)
- Involved in recruitment and (pre-)selection candidates 'Promoties in de Geesteswetenschappen program'
- Research quality assurance (audits, visitations, midterm reviews etc).

Education
- Education and Examination Regulations (EER) of all programmes 
- Examination policy, contact person for examination and curriculum committees. 
- Project management of projects on career orientation and career development of students, training teachers on development of learning goals in curriculum of various courses.
- Part of project team responsible for developing new digital platform for students: www.students.uu.nl

Training:
- Annual Training Council for Advancement and Support of Education (CASE) 2013 & 2014 (www.case.org)
